content.description: A little contrived at the start, but the moves are nice anyway.  Worth a lap.  Finishes in the right facing shallow dihedral near the top.
content.protection: Fairly sparse, unless you veer over onto "The Turret".
content.location: Starts 2-3 feet right of the Turret.  Try not to share handholds!

content.description: A blank looking face above leads to feature that seem to come out of nowhere!
content.location: South face of the Turret. Follow the left crack until it disappears and follow the corner to the top.

content.description:
Scramble up into the chimney, then exit to the left toward the top. 

  The cruxes are bypassing chockstones.
content.location: The left side of the Turret, facing west toward the Lake.  Above the access to the top of Railroad Amphitheater.

content.description: Start inside the corner. Follow crack system to just under the overhang. Once at overhang traverse left to ledge. From ledge go straight up to top.
content.protection: Nuts to finger size cams. Two trees at top for anchor.
content.location: This climb is located up and to the right of waterfall wall. This climb is on the opposite side of the climb the turret. Could be number 20 in the DL book on the turret. Can anyone confirm this? You can either rappel down or walk off.

content.description: The more obvious way to do "Turret Direct".  Climb the outer corner into the upper dihedral.
content.protection: sparse until you hit the upper dihedral
content.location: The corner right of "Turret" and "Turret Direct".  This routes joins "Turret Direct" (or vice versa) for the final dihedral.

content.description: Small wall with a few climbs.
